meanings.definition: A place in a church where sacred vessels and vestments are kept.
meanings.sent1: The priest carefully placed the chalice back in the sacrarium.
meanings.sent2: The sacristan organized the sacred items in the sacrarium.
meanings.sent3: During the service, the choir director accidentally dropped his phone in the sacrarium!
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a sacrarium, holding all the precious memories close.
meanings.sent5: The dim light in the sacrarium created a mysterious atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A receptacle for the disposal of sacred substances.
meanings.sent1: The nun poured the leftover holy water into the sacrarium.
meanings.sent2: The church janitor cleaned the sacrarium every week.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to hide his candy in the sacrarium.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a sacrarium, where only pure thoughts were allowed.
meanings.sent5: The sacrarium was filled with rose petals after the wedding ceremony.
